resources.string: Hidden among tropical plants and sheltered from the sun the natural springs of La Ojo de Agua are just waiting to cool you off.
Watch the Sunset at Punta Jesus Maria

Everybody loves a sunset, and it doesn\'t get much better than the one you can find at Punta Jesus Maria. Sure, the beach isn\'t particularly beautiful but when the setting sun casts an enchanting orange hue across the twin peaks of Ometepe\'s volcanoes you'll not want to be anywhere else.
Balgüe / Santa Cruz / La Palma, Merida / San Ramon

You can actually climb both the volcanoes that make up Ometepe, but the most popular by far is Volcan Concepcion. However, before you get too excited, do bear in mind that this is not an easy hike – the people we spoke to who had completed it stated that it was actually the toughest they had ever undertaken.

On the southern slopes of the Volcán Maderas, around 4 km from the beach in San Ramon, you will find the waterfall. At 64m high, it\'s definitely a little more impressive than some others you'll find dotted around the country.
Altagracia, Balgüe / Santa Cruz / La Palma, Charco Verde Area, Merida / San Ramon, Moyogalpa, Santo Domingo

Ometepe is famous for its rich pre–Columbian past and belongs to the great rock art areas of the world. Ancient petroglyphs (rock carvings) and stone statues have been found all over the island, along with sites containing ceramic urns, pottery and utensils.
Balgüe / Santa Cruz / La Palma, Merida / San Ramon

A couple of thousand years ago the summit of the Maderas exploded and a multitude of lava boulders were scattered all around the slopes of the volcano. Today, the truncated cone of the Maderas is covered in thick cloud forest. On its summit a crater lagoon has formed where you can swim in a serene setting.

El Zopilote is the best secret on Ometepe! Nestled in the most beautiful surroundings, pathways meander through the forest with different structures all over. The views of the volcano from the lookout towers over the forest canopy are amazing. Don\'t miss Pizza Night!

Accommodation, Wi–Fi, Tour information, Restaurant, Yoga, Volunteer opportunities, Permaculture courses, organic products, macramé, hiking, guided tours, bread making course, bee keeping, pottery course, horse riding, Spanish lessons, slakline and aerial silk, massage, tattoo.

This eco–lodge (located in a wonderfully rural part of the island, near Merida) is an excellent choice for those wanting to give back a little – its profits fund a local school which is intertwined with the hacienda. No kitchen but an on–site restaurant and coconut ice cream to die for!

Accommodation, Free Wi–Fi, Beachfront, Free Parking, Bar/Lounge, Laundry Service, Multilingual staff, Kids Activities, Tour information, Restaurant, Mountain bikes, Kayaks, Sailing adventures, Horseback riding, Volunteer opportunities

A relaxing, tranquil B&B hotel with a swimming pool in a gorgeous garden setting located just on the edge of Moyogalpa. Accommodation options include private cabins, spacious rooms and a dormitory. Tours and activities offered.
Free Breakfast, Scooter & ATV Rentals, Private Transportation, Bicycle Rentals, Massages, Manicures & Pedicures, Laundry Services, Volcano Hikes, Horseback Riding, Kayaking.

Cafe Campestre prepares fresh food daily using organic ingredients many of which are from our farm. We are passionate about food and have created a varied and interesting menu featuring local and international cuisines. We have great local coffee, a relaxed environment, Wi–Fi and some of the most interesting and innovative English language tours on Ometepe.
Takeout, Outdoor Seating, Seating, Waitstaff, Serves Alcohol
Moyogalpa\'s favorite pizzeria, right on the main drag, offers a wide menu of pies, pastas and seafood dishes.
Suitable for vegetarians. Fresh salads. Vegetarian pastas. Freshly prepared food. The best smoothies. Natural juices…
: Seating, Waitstaff, Parking Available, Street Parking, Serves Alcohol, Wine and Beer, Free Wi–Fi

Our restaurant offers freshly made and nutritionally balanced meals using organic and locally sourced produce. Our portions are generous, and motto is quality and taste! We also have a great wine list to compliment your meal.

Outdoor Seating, Waitstaff, Parking Available, Highchairs Available, Serves Alcohol, Wine and Beer, Accepts American Express, Accepts Mastercard, Accepts Visa, Digital Payments, Free Wifi, Seating, Accepts Credit Cards

Vegetarian restaurant serving delicious breakfasts, lunches and dinners. Great pastas, curries, stirfries. Beach Dining with a wonderful view of the Maderas volcano. Connect to our wifi with your laptop/tablet/phone while enjoying a great coffee or glass of wine. And don\'t miss our famous batidos!
